benchmark_details.name: CaseGen
benchmark_details.overview: CaseGen is the first comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate large language models (LLMs) in multi-stage legal case document generation. It includes 500 real case samples annotated by legal experts and supports four key tasks: drafting defense statements, writing trial facts, composing legal reasoning, and generating judgment results.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust framework for evaluating LLMs in legal case document generation, identifying strengths and weaknesses in current models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: CaseGen is built on Chinese legal cases and may not capture the diversity and complexity of legal systems worldwide.

data.source: 500 high-quality legal cases selected from China Judgments Online after rigorous filtering and annotation.
data.annotation: Annotations were conducted by legal experts to ensure quality and compliance with legal standards.

methodology.calculation: LLM judges score generated documents based on task-oriented criteria and a reference answer.
methodology.interpretation: Scores from LLM judges are aligned with legal expert annotations indicating quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared LLM generated documents against high-quality reference documents.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations confirm the assessment framework's effectiveness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All personal identifiers have been removed from the datasets to ensure privacy.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license for non-commercial academic use.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The development adhered to privacy protection laws and data security regulations.
